title: Potion of sleeping
data:
**[English]()** • [中文（中国大陆）‎](/wiki/Potion_of_sleeping/zh-CN "Potion of sleeping/zh-CN")

| ! [![Pink potion.png](/images/7/79/Pink_potion.png)](/wiki/File:Pink_potion.png) |                                                                                 |
| -------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Name                                                                             | sleeping                                                                        |
| Appearance                                                                       | [random](/wiki/Randomised_appearance "Randomised appearance")                   |
| Base price                                                                       | 100 [zm](/wiki/Zorkmid "Zorkmid")                                               |
| Weight                                                                           | 20                                                                              |
| Monster use                                                                      | *May be used [offensively](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item") by monsters.* |

The **potion of sleeping** can make you fall asleep.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Effects](#Effects)
- [2 Encyclopedia entry](#Encyclopedia_entry)
- [3 See also](#See_also)
- [4 References](#References)

## Effects

[Quaffing](/wiki/Quaff "Quaff") a blessed potion puts you to sleep for for 13-23 turns, an uncursed one for 25-35 turns, and a cursed one for 37-47 turns.

If you have [sleep resistance](/wiki/Sleep_resistance "Sleep resistance") or [free action](/wiki/Free_action "Free action"), "you yawn" and the potion will have no effect.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Monsters will throw these at you. If the potion hits you, then the [vapors](/wiki/Vapor "Vapor") will make you fall asleep ("You feel rather tired.") for 1 to 5 turns, and [abuse](/wiki/Abuse "Abuse") your dexterity.[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) If the potion hits a monster, then the monster temporarily sleeps ("*(The monster)* falls asleep.") for 1 to 12 turns, unless the vapors miss the monster or the monster has sleep resistance.[\[3\]](#cite_note-3)

## Encyclopedia entry

This entry is also used for the [potion of booze](/wiki/Potion_of_booze "Potion of booze").

On waking, he found himself on the green knoll whence he had first seen the old man of the glen. He rubbed his eyes -- it was a bright sunny morning. The birds were hopping and twittering among the bushes, and the eagle was wheeling aloft, and breasting the pure mountain breeze. "Surely," thought Rip, "I have not slept here all night." He recalled the occurrences before he fell asleep. The strange man with a keg of liquor -- the mountain ravine -- the wild retreat among the rocks -- the woe-begone party at ninepins -- the flagon -- "Oh! that flagon! that wicked flagon!" thought Rip -- "what excuse shall I make to Dame Van Winkle!"

\[ Rip Van Winkle, a Posthumous Writing of Diedrich Knickerbocker, by Washington Irving ]

## See also

- [paralysis](/wiki/Paralysis "Paralysis")
- [meditating](/wiki/Meditating "Meditating")

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [potion.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 611](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/potion.c#line611 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/potion.c")
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [potion.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 1263](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/potion.c#line1263 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/potion.c")
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [potion.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 1062](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/potion.c#line1062 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/potion.c")

**This page may need to be updated for the [current version](/wiki/Current_version "Current version") of *NetHack*.**

It may contain text specific to [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"). Information on this page may be out of date.

**Editors:** After reviewing this page and making necessary edits, please change the {{nethack-343}} tag to the current version's tag or {{noversion}} as appropriate.

Potion of sleeping

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
English

 • 中文（中国大陆）‎
!
Name sleeping
Appearance random
Base price 100 zm
Weight 20
Monster use May be used offensively by monsters.

The potion of sleeping can make you fall asleep.

Contents

  • 1 Effects
  • 2 Encyclopedia entry
  • 3 See also
  • 4 References

Effects

Quaffing a blessed potion puts you to sleep for for 13-23 turns, an uncursed one for 25-35 turns, and a cursed one for 37-47 turns.

If you have sleep resistance or free action, "you yawn" and the potion will have no effect.[1]

Monsters will throw these at you. If the potion hits you, then the vapors will make you fall asleep ("You feel rather tired.") for 1 to 5 turns, and abuse your dexterity.[2] If the potion hits a monster, then the monster temporarily sleeps ("(The monster) falls asleep.") for 1 to 12 turns, unless the vapors miss the monster or the monster has sleep resistance.[3]

This entry is also used for the potion of booze.

On waking, he found himself on the green knoll whence he had first seen the old man of the glen. He rubbed his eyes -- it was a bright sunny morning. The birds were hopping and twittering among the bushes, and the eagle was wheeling aloft, and breasting the pure mountain breeze. "Surely," thought Rip, "I have not slept here all night." He recalled the occurrences before he fell asleep. The strange man with a keg of liquor -- the mountain ravine -- the wild retreat among the rocks -- the woe-begone party at ninepins -- the flagon -- "Oh! that flagon! that wicked flagon!" thought Rip -- "what excuse shall I make to Dame Van Winkle!"

[ Rip Van Winkle, a Posthumous Writing of Diedrich Knickerbocker, by Washington Irving ]
